title: Qwiklabs
description: Qwiklabs is a learning platform for those who want to become more familiar with operating cloud environments.

title: Codelabs
description: Codelabs provide a guided, hands-on coding experience. Most codelabs will step you through the process of building a small application, or adding a new feature to an existing application.

title: Tech Dev Guide
description: Wondering what computer science is all about, or what it’s like to work in the tech industry? Dig deeper into products, careers, and more with these carefully curated resources.

title: Dartpad
description: This project is a web based interactive Dart service in a zero-install, zero configuration environment.

title: Khan Academy
description: Khan Academy is a non-profit educational organization created in 2008 by Salman Khan with the goal of creating a set of online tools that help educate students.

title: GA Dash
description: This is General Assembly’s free online learning platform. It's entirely project-based–you build a “project” with each walkthrough–making it ideal for those who like to get hands-on while learning to code online.

title: Dev.to
description: Where programmers share ideas and help each other grow.

title: Hackr.io
description: This isn't a platform itself, but it's a great list of community-curated programming resources.

title: Google Design
description: A directory of essential design tools and resources to keep your projects moving forward

title: Microsoft Virtual Academy
description: Microsoft Virtual Academy’s Learning Paths are curated free coding courses designed to help you build valuable skills through video tutorials, demos, assessments, and more.

title: Edabit
description: Edabit is “like Duolingo for learning to code,” offering bite-sized coding challenges that simulate what programming is like in the real world.

title: Codeanywhere.com
description: Codeanywhere is a cross-platform Cloud IDE. Codeanywhere enables users to instantly write, edit, collaborate and run web development projects

title: Codeacademy
description: Codecademy is an online interactive platform that offers free coding classes in 12 different Programming Languages.

title: Codewars
description: An educational community for programming. On the platform, software developers train on programming challenges known as kata.

title: Freecodecamp
description: freeCodeCamp is a non-profit organization that consists of an interactive learning web platform, an online community forum and more.

title: W3Schools
description: W3Schools is an educational website for learning web technologies online. Content includes tutorials and references.

title: The Odin Project
description: The Odin Project was created to provide a complete path for students to go from zero to employed as web developers while working with other students.

title: Scotch.io
description: Scotch Development is a web development blog discussing all things programming, development, web and life. It was founded by it's primary authors Nicholas Cerminara and Chris Sevilleja.

title: Nodeschool.io
description: Nodeschool is a series of open-source command line workshops published on nodeschool.io by developers, and created to teach people the basic concepts of node programming.

title: Mozilla Developer Network
description: Mozilla Developer Network is the official Mozilla website for development documentation of web standards

title: Web.dev
description: As the web advances, users' expectations get higher. With web.dev's guidance, you can give your users the best possible experience, wherever they are.

title: Google Developers
description: Google Developers is Google's site for software development tools, APIs, and technical resources. The site contains documentation for tools and APIs.

title: Papers with Code
description: Papers With Code is a free and open resource with Machine Learning papers, code and evaluation tables.

title: CS50
description: CS50 is Harvard University's introduction to computer science and the art of programming.

title: Dev Ed
description: Learn web development, web design, 3d modelling with tools like Figma, and more without getting bored!

title: DesignCourse
description: You will see tutorials regarding UI/UX, Frontend Dev, Backend Dev, Graphic Design and more!

title: The Coding Train
description: Subjects covered range from the basics of programming languages to generative algorithms like simulation & computer vision.

title: Traversy Media
description: Traversy Media features web development and programming tutorials for all of the latest web technologies.

title: Fireship
description: Formerly Angular Firebase, It helps developers build high quality apps as fast as possible ⚡. Uses all the modern Frameworks.

title: IBM Developer
description: IBM Developer provides the best in open source tech, learning resources, by their experts.

title: Codegrid
description: Provides online content to help people learn about many concepts of web design, by implementing prolific tools.

title: Coding Tech
description: It partners with the tech conferences around the world that allow their videos to be republished here.

title: FreeCodeCamp
description: We're an open source community of busy people who learn to code and build projects for nonprofits. And let others learn.

title: JSConf
description: JSConf is a series of JavaScript conferences from around the world.Find the Talks here.

title: Flutter
description: The Official Flutter YouTube channel. Subscribe to stay up to date with best practices about the Flutter SDK.

title: Two Minute Papers
description: Two Minute Papers is a series where the author attempt to explain many interesting research works, a couple minutes at a time.

title: The Android Bundle
description: In the free, self-paced Android Kotlin Fundamentals training, you learn basic Android programming concepts using the Kotlin programming language.

title: Kotlin Bootcamp
description: Learn the essentials of the Kotlin programming language from Kotlin experts at Google. Kotlin is a modern and concise JVM language that supports functional programming paradigms.

title: Android Kotlin Fundamentals
description: Android Kotlin Fundamentals leads you through a series of codelabs that teach you the fundamentals of building Android apps in Kotlin.

title: Web Crash Course
description: Google's opinionated reference for building amazing web experiences.

title: AMP for dummies
description: These courses treat AMP as a web components library that takes care of web performance issues automatically.

title: Actions on Google
description: These codelabs provide a guided, tutorial, hands-on coding experience. The codelabs will step you through the process of building an Action, or extending your Actions for specific use cases.

title: The Code Player
description: What makes this site unique is its videos and presentations that showcase code created by others. You also get a detailed description of the topic at hand. This makes sense, since most of us want to see code built from scratch before we take aim at replication. Since you are learning from real case studies, you get a better idea of how to use a specific programming language.
